SwiftMessageFormat.name: MT21FIN_ACKNAK
SwiftMessageFormat.DescriptiveName: Acknowledgement of a FIN Message Sent by an LT (ACK/NAK)
SwiftMessageFormat.Description:
This message confirms that the system has received a message from a user, and that the system has either accepted (ACK) or rejected (NAK) the message.
From: FIN To: User
Notes The Basic Header identifies the message which is being acknowledged. The LT in the Basic Header is exactly the same as the sending LT in the input message header

SystemField.Name: date-time
SystemField.description: Date and time, local to the user, of this message.

SwiftSystemFieldDef.Name: date-time
SwiftSystemFieldDef.Description: Date and time are always given as local, unless otherwise specified. Local time for the SWIFT Network is in GMT.

SystemField.Name: accept-reject
SystemField.description:
Accepted or rejected, where:
a) 0 = accepted
b) 1 = rejected

SwiftSystemFieldDef.Name: accept-reject
SwiftSystemFieldDef.Description:
Accepted or rejected, where:
a) 0 = accepted
b) 1 = rejected

SystemField.Name: rejection-reason
SystemField.description:
Reason for rejection. See the SWIFTNet FIN Error Codes module for the full set of error codes.
Also contains a line number (for user-to-user messages) or a field number (for system messages).

SwiftSystemFieldDef.Name: rejection-reason
SwiftSystemFieldDef.Description:
Reason for rejection. See the SWIFTNet FIN Error Codes module for the full set of error codes.
Also contains a line number (for user-to-user messages) or a field number (for system messages).

SystemField.Name: mur
SystemField.description: Contains one of the following: a) Mesage user reference as used in the header of the original message if present.

SwiftSystemFieldDef.Name: mur
SwiftSystemFieldDef.Description: Message User Reference as used in the header of the original message
